data.text: How to Locate a GPX File for the Eurovelo 8?
Trying to locate a GPX file for the Eurovelo 8. Seems an impossible task? Can anyone help please? Thanks.

data.author: Marco van Dijk

data.text: Thanks for the responses. Here‚Äôs the problem (Perhaps I should have been more specific): I upload my files to Komoot, which syncs with my Wahoo Bolt. But, of the various different EV8 files I try to upload, Kommot will not load them because they are too large. Basically, how do I get the EV8 route onto my Wahoo Bolt please?! Thanks!
data.author: Keith Foskett

data.text: , try RIDEWGPS instead.
data.author: Jeremy Lawrence

data.text: You need to lower the number of way points, and RideWithGPS does it automatically so listen to JeremyüëÜ
data.author: James Schoettgen

data.text: just cut the big file in smaller pieces. For example, you can make multiple copies, edit them and change the start/end on each. I'm no expert at all though, there might be better solutions
data.author: Pierre Moreels

data.text: I cut all my gpx'es in parts of max 200km, that way it keeps having high details and the gps unit will not complain. But I would not use komoot as in between, it has trouble with big routes indeed.
data.author: Gert Pellin

data.text: Yup, definitely split route up into smaller segments. That way if a file glitches for some reason. It's only a small part of entire route. You can also overlap each section 50% as redundancy incase a segment has an issue. If say you do a master route of 1000km in RWGPS, simply duplicate route, then select sections you want to delete [see screengrab] and save the remaining sections for example as day 1, day 2 etc. Or any naming that makes sense to yourself. You could use say Barcelona to Perpignan, Perpignan to Montpellier etc. Or use both' Day 5 - Barcelona to Perpignan'.
data.author: Jeremy Lawrence
